#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) is a well-established and progressive defense contracting company in the Northern Virginia area just a few miles south of the Pentagon. We are a professional services firm established in 1972 that has a long-standing reputation for unrivaled technical and analytical support to some of the top decision makers in the Federal Sector. We do state of the art work and have a cadre of outstanding professionals on our team.

This internship is with the Surety Programs Group (SPG) which supports government and private sector organizations ensuring the security, safety, and reliability of high consequence operations. SPG’s philosophy is to help our clients understand and mitigate mission risks spanning physical, cyber, and human domains. The Data Science Intern will work as part of a cross-functional team responsible for systematically evaluating client threats, vulnerabilities, performance, and cost-risk trades.

SPA has near-term need for a Data Science Intern.

The Data Science Intern will participate in a range of analytical tasks including descriptive, explanatory, and forecasting projects. They will assist senior staff with data gathering, cleaning, storage, mining, analysis, statistical modeling, and visualization. In addition, the Intern will help senior staff develop new or improved analytical capabilities and tools.

Pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, quantitative social sciences, or related discipline
Experience with data gathering, cleaning, storage, mining, analysis, statistical modeling, and visualization
Experience developing databases using either SQL Server or Access
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with data analysis tools such as R, Tableau, Python, MATLAB, SAS, Stata, etc.
U.S. citizen with ability to obtain DoD security clearance

Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
About Faraday

Faraday helps consumer brands find, convert, engage, and retain more customers using AI. Located in the historic Maltex Building in beautiful Burlington, Vermont, we're a fast-growing venture-backed startup founded in 2012.

Our values

We believe in privacy and are committed to ending the widespread proliferation of consumer data. We believe in science and the power of statistically significant conclusions. We believe in equality and reject all forms of algorithmic prejudice. We believe in health and fun and encourage a positive work/life balance.

Our dedication to diversity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Our Data Science Team

At the heart of the Faraday AI platform is a shared machine learning pipeline framework built from the ground up. Our data scientists work with clients and their Faraday account managers to carefully define one or more business goals for deployment on the platform. The pipeline uses these "outcome" definitions to perform ETL/ELT, training data formation, feature engineering, model building, validation, scoring, and deployment.

Your team is also responsible for curating the Faraday Identity Graph (FIG) from upstream data sources, preparing interpretive analysis for clients, and nurturing Faraday’s quantitative culture.

About Your Role

We're looking for a data science intern to join us at Faraday. You will pursue a variety of challenges, including:
Determining the best predictive approaches to meet clients’ business outcomes.
Assisting with research and development of new algorithms, tools, and methods
Communicating and providing context to clients.
Being curious—there’s so much we don’t know in the world of data science, and our only guaranteed driver of innovation is the collaborative work of open minds.

You Have Good Interpersonal Abilities Which You Will Employ Regularly, Including

You are a methodical, self-motivated individual, capable of keeping your eye on the finish line amidst competing priorities.
Weekly team meetings
Transparent project tracking
Following security protocols to keep sensitive data safe

Your credentials

This position would be best filled by someone who has finished - or is in pursuit of - a relevant degree in data science, statistics, natural science, mathematics, computer science, or other related field.

Your Experience
You have experience with statistical inference
You have experimented with the practical applications of data science

Your technical background
You’ve used Python and SQL
You’re familiar with data visualization best practices

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau
Chegg out our intern program!

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE
Remote, United States

Organization: Thinkful Data Science & Analytics

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Chegg out our intern program!

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE
Remote, United States

Organization: Thinkful Data Science & Analytics

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Chegg out our intern program!

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
At Shipt, we are transforming the grocery shopping experience and giving time back to consumers. Shipt shoppers handpick fresh groceries and household essentials, then deliver them to your door in as little as one hour.
What does Data Science Do at Shipt?

At Shipt, we work at the intersection of a multi-sided marketplace and we’re looking for help understanding data collected across this complex marketplace, optimizing existing processes, and making predictions to help improve the product and experience.

Our team tackles a wide variety of projects, ranging from developing sophisticated predictive and machine learning models, conducting ad-hoc research, working with engineers on service development and deployments, and presenting results to functional teams. Our ideal candidate will be data-driven, intellectually curious, and a clear communicator.

What You’ll Gain

Our team is growing and we’re looking for a Data Scientist Intern. You’ll dive into some of the company’s most challenging business questions and help the company make data-driven decisions. This is a paid, full-time internship.

Your Responsibilities
Work closely with business teams to identify important questions and answer them with data
Perform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of the problem
Apply statistical models on large datasets for inferential and predictive purposes
Design, analyze, and communicate the results of experiments

Requirements
2+ years of relevant school or work experience
Experience analyzing data using SQL and R or Python
Passion for solving complex real-world problems with data
Willingness to collaborate and communicate with others to solve a problem
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

requirements:

Remote, United States

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
Data Science Intern 2021 Job Description:

Based in Palo Alto, California, Prealize Health is a predictive analytics company that leverages machine learning and clinical expertise to help patients obtain better care, sooner. Most of healthcare today is very reactive – with care being delivered when someone is already ill. We believe that healthcare should be about keeping individuals and their families well – to prevent them from ever becoming sick. Building on years of published research from our founders at Stanford University, our mission is to give patients, providers, and payers the insights they need to improve patient health and prevent adverse medical events. Through machine learning and the extensive experience of our founders, team, and advisors in healthcare, we are committed to helping healthcare organizations see around the corner so that they can take a proactive approach to helping patients.

We are seeking a Data Science Intern to join our team this summer. You will work closely with other

data scientists, product managers and clients to help develop data-driven products that will directly

affect patient lives. Your contribution in data modeling and machine learning applications will be crucial

to our mission and the success of the company.

As a Data Science Intern you will:

Develop and apply methods in machine learning, deep learning and statistics to expand and improve our product offerings

Work closely with our clients to understand their needs and translate them into ML- powered solutions that identify and prevent any type of bias

Work with our product team to ensure we create the highest value products possible for our partners

Work with our engineering team to enhance the quality, robustness, and extensibility of our platform for millions of patients

Work with our advisors and keep up to date on relevant literature to ensure we use the best approaches available

Document and present your work to the team

You will love this job if:

You enjoy translating high-level goals and business use cases into concrete implementations

You are passionate about making an impact in healthcare and want to work in a fast- paced environment

You love to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders

You are passionate about scalable and reproducible machine learning

Qualifications:

• Pursuing a degree in computer science, math, statistics, biostatistics, bioengineering or

any related field

• Fluent in Python, R, or similar programming language

• Experience working with machine learning regression and classification approaches

(random forests, neural networks, etc.)

• Familiar with software development tools, like version control

• Experience working on interdisciplinary, collaborative projects

• Ability to research and come up with strategies to solve novel challenges

• Excellent communication skills

Nice to Have but Not Required:

Experience in deep learning

Experience in the healthcare domain, including healthcare finance

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
We are looking for a Data Science Intern for May 6, 2021 - August 6, 2021 who will support the Data Science team by developing and delivering projects that fulfill immediate business needs. You’ll gain solid exposure to the digital advertising ecosystem as part of our dynamic internship program and expand upon your professional skill set in a unique and fun environment.

About The Job

As a Data Science intern you will be responsible for assisting the Data Science team in projects that span Sovrn’s multiple business lines, and your assignments will involve a mix of data engineering, data science and machine learning tasks. The anticipated project involves incorporating web site category data into Sovrn’s Ad Exchange, employing this data for auction optimization, and assessing its resulting monetary impact.

What You’ll Be Doing
Developing a method of mapping content category data from one taxonomy to another
Automating ETL of re-mapped data into Sovrn’s Ad Exchange
Analysis of subsequent yield impacts resulting from category data
Training of a machine learning model to use this category data as a feature
Analysis of resulting machine learning model performance
Learning many new skills and data science techniques


About You

You’re driven, thoughtful, and curious. You can break down your work into steps, and can sequence deliveries for maximum velocity and impact. You assess risks, but are not afraid to act. Above all, you’re open to learning.

The Successful Candidate Will Have
Undergraduate coursework in pursuit of a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science or a related field.
Facility with Python and SQL.
Familiarity with one or more of: AWS, GCP, Bash, or Git.
Experience with Google Drive programs such as Docs, Sheets and Slides.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and capable of prioritizing and managing daily duties.
Ability to efficiently multi-task and to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees to maximize performance, creativity, problem-solving and results.
Desire for professional growth opportunities and to be in a dynamic learning environment.
Excitement about being part of a fast-paced Data Science team.
Ability to work 40 hours a week.
Ability to commit to a term of no less than 3 months.

Bonus Points
Familiarity with one or more of Java, Scala, JavaScript, and C/C++.

This position reports to: Director, Data Science

Location: Boulder, Colorado

We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of accountability impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We expect you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we're looking for.

About Sovrn

Publishers create the content the world depends on for education, entertainment, and commerce. Sovrn provides products and services to tens of thousands of online publishers to help them grow, operate their business, understand their readership, and manage consumer data. Sovrn is headquartered in Boulder, Colorado with offices in San Francisco, New York, and London.

With 10,000 customers deploying one or more products across 30,000 websites, Sovrn reaches 200M consumers across more than 3.5B pageviews everyday. Sovrn has been a leader in online publisher technology since its founding, and has been recognized by IAB, JICWEBS, and TAG for its role in combating advertising fraud and promoting pro-transparency initiatives. Sovrn is dedicated to helping content creators do more of what they love, and less of what they don’t.

Sovrn Core Values: Candid, Customer Empathy, Learning, Scrappy, Second Order Thinking

Compensation And Benefits

In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the compensation range for this role in Boulder, Colorado is $20.00 - $25.00 an hour. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills and certifications.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Sovrn is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, parental or pregnancy status, marriage and civil partnership, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Reasonable accommodations will be made to meet the requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act and will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
Data Science Intern 2021 Job Description:

Based in Palo Alto, California, Prealize Health is a predictive analytics company that leverages machine learning and clinical expertise to help patients obtain better care, sooner. Most of healthcare today is very reactive – with care being delivered when someone is already ill. We believe that healthcare should be about keeping individuals and their families well – to prevent them from ever becoming sick. Building on years of published research from our founders at Stanford University, our mission is to give patients, providers, and payers the insights they need to improve patient health and prevent adverse medical events. Through machine learning and the extensive experience of our founders, team, and advisors in healthcare, we are committed to helping healthcare organizations see around the corner so that they can take a proactive approach to helping patients.

We are seeking a Data Science Intern to join our team this summer. You will work closely with other

data scientists, product managers and clients to help develop data-driven products that will directly

affect patient lives. Your contribution in data modeling and machine learning applications will be crucial

to our mission and the success of the company.

As a Data Science Intern you will:

Develop and apply methods in machine learning, deep learning and statistics to expand and improve our product offerings
Work closely with our clients to understand their needs and translate them into ML- powered solutions that identify and prevent any type of bias
Work with our product team to ensure we create the highest value products possible for our partners
Work with our engineering team to enhance the quality, robustness, and extensibility of our platform for millions of patients
Work with our advisors and keep up to date on relevant literature to ensure we use the best approaches available
Document and present your work to the team

You will love this job if:
You enjoy translating high-level goals and business use cases into concrete implementations
You are passionate about making an impact in healthcare and want to work in a fast- paced environment
You love to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are passionate about scalable and reproducible machine learning
Qualifications:

Pursuing a degree in computer science, math, statistics, biostatistics, bioengineering or

any related field

Fluent in Python, R, or similar programming language
Experience working with machine learning regression and classification approaches

(random forests, neural networks, etc.)

Familiar with software development tools, like version control
Experience working on interdisciplinary, collaborative projects
Ability to research and come up with strategies to solve novel challenges
Excellent communication skills

Nice to Have but Not Required:

Experience in deep learning

Experience in the healthcare domain, including healthcare finance

Powered by JazzHR

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau
Chegg out our intern program!

http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE
Remote, United States

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau

The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Chegg out our intern program!

http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Chegg out our intern program!

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau
Chegg out our intern program!

http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

Remote, United States

Organization: Thinkful Data Science & Analytics

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Chegg out our intern program!

http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.

Chegg out our intern program!

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE INTERNSHIP
Remote, United States

Organization: Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics

The Chegg Skills Data Science & Analytics team is composed of data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and business leaders and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new careers products and services at Chegg.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science and analytics problems within the education and career space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and analytical skills to help make critical business decisions and drive key business metrics.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and business teams to understand project goals.
Identify, gather and transform data from a variety of sources.
Perform rigorous statistical analysis, including significance testing, forecasting, and modeling.
Build dashboards, slide decks, reports, and presentations to share analytical insights with stakeholders and business leaders.

Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor/MS Degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics and improve product efficiencies
Strong data extraction skills using SQL
Experience with advanced analytical and data visualization methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with real-world data that may be ambiguous or incomplete
Strong creative and critical thinking skills. Attention to details.
Buy-in to Chegg’s mission of providing support for students undertaking their next big challenge
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2021

Nice To Have
Experience with Databricks
Experience using Amazon Web Services
Experience building dashboards through platforms like Tableau
Chegg out our intern program!

http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university

#LI- MI

title: Data Science Intern
requirements:
DATA SCIENCE
Remote, United States

Organization: Thinkful Data Science & Analytics

The Thinkful Data Science & Analytics team comprises data scientists and business analysts. The team influences strategy and works closely with product, engineering, marketing, finance, and business leaders, and is responsible for generating insights and reporting for the new online learning products at Thinkful, a Chegg service.

Role: Data Science Internship

We’re looking for highly motivated interns to join our team and work on a number of applied data science problems within the online education space. Interns on our Data Science team will apply data mining and statistical algorithms to drive key business metrics and help grow revenue from Thinkful courses.

Responsibilities
Work closely with others on the Data Science & Analytics team, as well as cross-functionally with product, marketing, engineering, and finance teams to understand project goals.
Identify potential data sources. Conduct exploratory data analyses.
Utilize supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to identify clusters and trends and to build predictive models and forecasts.
Establish model evaluation metrics. Evaluate model performance. Interpret and present model conclusions to help drive strategic business decisions.
Requirements
Pursuing an MS/Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., science, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics)
A strong interest in using data mining and statistical models to understand user needs, drive business metrics, and improve product efficiencies
Good data cleaning and data mining skills with strong attention to details
Experience with machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python or R
Experience with SQL for aggregating and retrieving data from relational databases
Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Strong creative and critical thinking skills
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer of 2020
What project will the intern work on?

Use statistical methods to solve issues associated with student behavior, funnel conversion, and product performance during the pre-enroll process.

What skills will the intern gain?

Data cleaning and data mining; regression, classification, and clustering techniques; and business application of machine learning models.
